newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian lived with tweezers 47 years.
newsitem.headline: Colombian lived with tweezers 47 years.

text.p: A Colombian man who lived with a pair of surgical tweezers inside his stomach for 47 years never felt them until recently, local news reports on Friday said.

In the last two months, Silivio Jimenez, a 67-year-old construction worker from the northern city of Valledupar, felt abdominal pains similar to those he must have felt in 1950 when doctors closed up a stab wound in his stomach.
X-rays revealed this week that the doctor who operated on Jimenez when he was a 20-year-old army conscript left his tweezers inside his patient.

"Despite everything I'm grateful to the doctor who operated on me in 1950 because I'm still alive," Jimenez told Bogota's El Tiempo newspaper. "But I'm upset because he left me with the tweezers. I'm not sure if it was just an oversight."
Jimenez was expected to go under the knife again in a matter of days to have the tweezers removed.
